turn.0: ELI5: Cigarettes. All you need is tobacco, paper and maybe some flammable material to mix up with tobacco. So why the fuck do I have to smoke polonium 13?
turn.1: Either because they don’t use apatite in their fertilizer, or more likely because they do but don’t tell you.
turn.2: How can they just "not tell me"? They are obliged by law
turn.3: Which law, US law? I’ve never seen a “may contain” list when purchasing cigars.
turn.4: I don’t live in US but I’m pretty sure they can’t hide what their products contain
turn.5: First of all, the polonium isn’t an ingredient, it’s not something they add to it, it’s left over from doing agriculture.   In the US cigarettes don’t have an ingredient list.  And if there was a “may contain traces of” list, it would be so long as to not fit on either a pack nor a carton.   I’m not a US lawyer and am even less familiar with the law in whatever country you’re in.
